meanings.definition: A place where people can access the internet using computers.
meanings.sent1: Many students visit cybercafes to do research for their school projects.
meanings.sent2: The cybercafes in town provide a convenient way for people to go online.
meanings.sent3: The cybercafes were so popular that they had to add more computers to keep up with the demand.
meanings.sent4: In a world without cybercafes, accessing the internet would be like searching for a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent5: The neon lights of the cybercafes beckoned to tech-savvy individuals looking to browse the web.

meanings.definition: A business that offers internet access to customers for a fee.
meanings.sent1: The cybercafes in the city charge reasonable rates for their services.
meanings.sent2: People often choose cybercafes over home internet for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent3: The cybercafes' profits soared after introducing a loyalty program for frequent customers.
meanings.sent4: In a digital age, cybercafes act as gateways to the vast online world for many.
meanings.sent5: The cozy atmosphere of the cybercafes made customers feel right at home while surfing the net.
